title: Prysm exit 1 on private network.
body:
### Description I created a private network by example. - 1 node(prysm +geth + validator ) work with --min-sync-peers=0 - 2 nodes(prysm + geth + validator) work with --min-sync-peers=1 - 1 node(prysm + geth ) work with --min-sync-peers=1 - 1 bootstrap node. For a while everything worked correctly. 3 prysm that had the --min-sync-peers=1 option crashed. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Not tested ## ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Node 1 
  
      - --min-sync-peers=0
      - --minimum-peers-per-subnet=0
      - --genesis-state=/files/genesis.ssz
      - --bootstrap-node=
      - --chain-config-file=/files/config.yml
      - --chain-id=${CHAIN_ID:-32382}
      - --rpc-host=0.0.0.0
      - --contract-deployment-block=0
      - --grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0
      - --execution-endpoint=http://geth1:8551
      - --accept-terms-of-use
      - --jwt-secret=/jwtsecret
      - --suggested-fee-recipient=
      - --verbosity=debug
      - --p2p-host-ip=
      - --p2p-tcp-port=13000
      - --p2p-udp-port=13000
      - --p2p-static-id
Node 2,Node 3 
  
     - --min-sync-peers=1
      - --minimum-peers-per-subnet=0
      - --genesis-state=/files/genesis.ssz
      - --bootstrap-node=
      - --chain-config-file=/files/config.yml
      - --chain-id=${CHAIN_ID:-32382}
      - --rpc-host=0.0.0.0
      - --grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0
      - --execution-endpoint=http://geth3:8551
      - --accept-terms-of-use
      - --jwt-secret=/jwtsecret
      - --suggested-fee-recipient=
      - --verbosity=debug
      - --p2p-tcp-port=13001 
      - --p2p-udp-port=13001 
      - --p2p-host-ip=
